Task ID: \h(«Pitiful Sailor»)You're not from around here, are ya?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Actually, we just came into town and we were
wondering if someone here could help us.\e

\h(«Pitiful Sailor»)So you came to me… 
Well, that's just great…\e

\h(«Don»)By the way, the name is Don. Now ask me your
question and be on your way.\e

\h(«Vyse»)You know that sky rift to the east… 
How do you get through it?\e

\h(«Don»)So, yer lookin' for a way to cross 
the Dark Rift, eh? \e

\h(«Don»)MWAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!
So, the world is still full of fools…\e
\h(«Vyse»)…?\e
\h(«Aika»)What?\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Are you kids serious?
You're trying to cross the Dark Rift?\e

\h(«Sailor»)They don't stand a chance. 
Someone better tell their parents where they
are.\e
\h(«Don»)Kid, that's no ordinary sky rift… \e

\h(«Don»)During the war, this cape was discovered…
And this city was built.\e

\h(«Don»)This place is the edge of the world. If you try
and go any further east, you'll be killed.
Hundreds of men… good men… have died tryin'.\e

\h(«Don»)But, there's always a few fools that don't 
heed the warnin's. The Dark Rift 
usually claims 'em…\e

\h(«Don»)Some of the best sailors from all over the world
tried to cross the Dark Rift. 
They came from everywhere…\e

\h(«Don»)One by one they tried to pass through 
the Dark Rift. All of them failed.\e

\h(«Don»)The ships that enter the Dark Rift are either 
pushed away by the winds…\e
\h(«Don»)…or they get sucked in, never to return.\e

\h(«Don»)My crew and I lost our ship. We were lucky to
survive. After a while, sailors stopped comin'.\e

\h(«Don»)All we do now is sit around here, and wait to
die…\e

\h(«Sailor»)Some things are just impossible, kid. Why don't
you just go back to wherever you came from and
have your mommy tell you bedtime stories.\e

\h(«Aika»)What's wrong with you people?!
You've thrown your lives away! 
Don't you care about anything?! \e

\h(«Aika»)Vyse, let's go!
We're just wasting our time here.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Thanks for telling me about the Dark Rift… 
Before I go, I just want to say that I've 
never met a more pitiful bunch in my life.\e

\h(«Vyse»)If you lose sight of one dream, replace it with
another. Think about how much you could have
accomplished in the time that you've spent here.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Just because you couldn't cross the Dark Rift, 
are you just going to sit here for the rest 
of your life?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Because you tried something once and failed, are
you going to throw the rest of your life away?\e

\h(«Vyse»)There's a whole world out there to see!
Don't you have any desire to sail again?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, what is it?\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse! Aika!
Come to the port! Quickly!\e
\h(«Fina»)The Armada is coming!!!\e

\h(«Aika»)What?!
What are they doing here?!\e

\h(«Vyse»)Aika, let's move!
We should hurry back to the port.\e
\h(«Marin Pitoyable»)Vous n'êtes pas d'ici vous, hein ?\e

\h(«Vyse»)En fait, nous venons juste d'arriver et nous
nous demandions si quelqu'un pouvait nous
aider.\e

\h(«Marin Pitoyable»)Alors vous êtes venus me voir……
Génial……\e

\h(«Don»)Au fait, je m'appelle Don. Posez-moi votre
question et fichez le camp.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Vous connaissez cette crevasse céleste à l'est……
Comment peut-on la traverser ?\e

\h(«Don»)Alors comme ça, vous cherchez un moyen de
traverser le Récif Noir, hein ? \e

\h(«Don»)AHAHAHAHAHA !!!!
Alors, il reste pas mal d'idiots dans le monde……\e
\h(«Vyse»)……?\e
\h(«Aika»)Quoi ?\e

\h(«Tavernier»)Vous êtes sérieux ?
Vous essayez de traverser le Récif Noir ?\e

\h(«Marin»)Ils n'ont aucune chance.
Il vaudrait mieux en informer leur parents.\e

\h(«Don»)Petit, ce n'est pas une crevasse céleste
ordinaire……\e

\h(«Don»)C'est pendant la guerre que ce cap a été
découvert……
Et que cette ville a été construite.\e

\h(«Don»)C'est le bout du monde ici. Si vous allez plus à
l'est, vous vous ferez tuer. Des centaines
d'hommes…… des hommes forts…… sont morts
en essayant.\e

\h(«Don»)Mais, mais il y a toujours des idiots qui
ignorent les avertissements. En principe, ils
sont victimes du Récif Noir……\e

\h(«Don»)Les meilleurs marins du monde entier ont essayé
de traverser le Récif Noir.
Ils venaient de partout……\e

\h(«Don»)Les uns après les autres, ils ont essayé de
traverser le Récif Noir. Ils ont tous échoué.\e

\h(«Don»)Les navires qui entrent dans le Récif Noir sont
soit refoulés par les vents……\e
\h(«Don»)……soit aspirés, et ne reviennent jamais.\e

\h(«Don»)Mon équipage et moi avons perdu notre navire.
Nous avons eu de la chance de survivre.
Peu après, les marins ont cessé de venir.\e

\h(«Don»)Alors nous restons assis ici, en attendant la
mort……\e

\h(«Marin»)Certaines choses sont impossibles à faire,
petit. Pourquoi ne retournes-tu pas d'où tu
viens ? Ta mère pourra te raconter des histoires
pour t'endormir.\e

\h(«Aika»)Quel est votre problème ?!
Vous avez gâchez vos vies !
Plus rien n'a d'importance pour vous ?!\e

\h(«Aika»)Vyse, partons !
Nous perdons notre temps ici.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Merci de m'avoir prévenu pour le Récif Noir……
Avant de partir, j'aimerais vous dire que je
n'ai jamais rencontré des gens aussi pitoyables
de toute ma vie.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Si vous perdez votre rêve, remplacez-le par un
autre. Pensez à tout ce que vous auriez pu faire
pendant tout ce temps passé ici.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ce n'est pas parce que vous n'avez pas réussi à
traverser le Récif Noir que vous allez passer le
reste de votre vie assis ici ?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Ce n'est pas parce que vous avez essuyé un échec
que vous allez gâcher toute votre vie ?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Il vous reste le monde entier à explorer !
Ne désirez-vous pas recommencer à
naviguer ?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, qu'est-ce qu'il y a ?\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse ! Aika !
Venez au port ! Vite !\e
\h(«Fina»)L'Armada arrive !!!\e

\h(«Aika»)Quoi ?!
Que font-ils ici ?!\e

\h(«Vyse»)Aika, partons !
Il faut se dépêcher d'aller au port.\e
\h(«Mitleid erregender Matrose»)Ihr seid nicht von hier, oder?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Wir sind erst seit gerade eben in der Stadt
und suchen jemanden, der uns helfen kann.\e

\h(«Mitleid erregender Matrose»)Also seid ihr zu mir gekommen……
Na, toll……\e

\h(«Don»)Übrigens, mein Name ist Don. Fragt mich, was
ihr wissen wollt, und haut ab.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Du kennst diese Turbulenz in östlicher
Richtung…… Wie kommt man da durch?\e

\h(«Don»)Ihr sucht also nach einer Möglichkeit, das
Dark Rift zu durchqueren, nicht wahr?\e

\h(«Don»)MWAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!
Die Welt ist also noch immer voller Narren……\e
\h(«Vyse»)……?\e
\h(«Aika»)Was?\e

\h(«Inhaber der Taverne»)Meint ihr das im Ernst?
Ihr Kids wollt versuchen, die Dark Rift zu
durchqueren?\e

\h(«Matrose»)Sie haben nicht die geringste Chance.
Jemand sollte ihren Eltern sagen, wo sie sie
abholen können.\e
\h(«Don»)Junge, das ist keine gewöhnliche Turbulenz……\e

\h(«Don»)Während des Krieges entdeckte man das Kap……
Und diese Stadt wurde erbaut.\e

\h(«Don»)Dieser Ort liegt am Ende der Welt. Wer versucht,
noch weiter nach Osten zu gehen, wird getötet.
Hunderte von Männern…… gute Männer…… haben bei
dem Versuch ihr Leben gelassen.\e

\h(«Don»)Aber es gibt immer ein paar Narren, die sich
nichts aus den Warnungen machen. Die werden
gewöhnlich von der Dark Rift geschluckt……\e

\h(«Don»)Einige der besten Schiffer aus der ganzen Welt
haben versucht, die Dark Rift zu durchqueren.
Sie kamen von überall her……\e

\h(«Don»)Einer nach dem anderen hat versucht, durch die
Dark Rift zu kommen. Keinem ist es gelungen.\e

\h(«Don»)Schiffe, die in die Dark Rift einfahren,
werden entweder vom Wind weggeblasen……\e

\h(«Don»)……oder sie werden von ihr aufgesogen und nie
mehr gesehen……\e

\h(«Don»)Meine Mannschaft und ich haben unser Schiff
verloren. Wir hatten Glück, dass wir mit dem
Leben davongekommen sind. Nach einer Weile sind
keine Matrosen mehr gekommen.\e

\h(«Don»)Jetzt sitzen wir nur noch hier herum und warten
auf den Tod……\e

\h(«Matrose»)Manche Sachen sind einfach unmöglich, Junge.
Warum gehst du nicht einfach dahin zurück, wo
du hergekommen bist, und lässt dir von Muttern
Geschichten vorlesen.\e

\h(«Aika»)Was ist denn mit euch los?!
Ihr habt euer Leben weggeworfen!
Ist euch denn alles egal?!\e

\h(«Aika»)Vyse, gehen wir!
Wir verschwenden hier unsere Zeit.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Danke für die Informationen über Dark Rift……
Bevor ich gehe, möchte ich nur sagen, dass ich
noch nie zuvor so einen jämmerlichen Haufen
wie euch getroffen habe.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Wenn man einen Traum aufgeben muss, muss man
ihn durch einen anderen ersetzen. Denkt doch
nur mal, wieviel ihr in der Zeit hättet
anstellen können, die ihr hier verbracht habt.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Nur weil ihr die Dark Rift nicht durchqueren
konntet, wollt ihr hier für den Rest eures
Lebens herumsitzen?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Weil euer erster Versuch fehlgeschlagen ist,
werft ihr den Rest eures Lebens weg?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Da draußen gibt es eine ganze Welt zu entdecken!
Habt ihr denn nicht den Wunsch, wieder zur See
zu fahren?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, was ist los?\e

\h(«Fina»)Vyse! Aika!
Kommt zum Hafen! Schnell!\e
\h(«Fina»)Die Armada kommt!!!\e

\h(«Aika»)Was?!
Was machen die denn hier?!\e

\h(«Vyse»)Aika, gehen wir!
Wir sollten schnell zurück zum Hafen.\e
\h(«Marino Penoso»)No sois de por aquí, ¿verdad?\e

\h(«Vyse»)La verdad es que acabamos de llegar y
necesitaríamos que alguien nos ayudara.\e

\h(«Marino Penoso»)Y venís a mí……
Bueno, eso es estupendo……\e

\h(«Don»)Por cierto, me llamo Don. Pregúntame lo que sea
y sigue tu camino.\e

\h(«Vyse»)¿Conoces la grieta celeste que hay al Este……?
¿Cómo se puede atravesar?\e
\h(«Don»)Así que queréis cruzar la Gruta Oscura, ¿eh?\e

\h(«Don»)¡¡¡¡JAJAJAJAJA!!!!
Ya veo que el mundo sigue lleno de idiotas……\e
\h(«Aika»)¿Qué?\e

\h(«Dueño de la Taberna»)¿Lo decís en serio?
¿Queréis cruzar la Gruta Oscura?\e

\h(«Marino»)No tenéis la menor posibilidad.
Alguien tendría que informar a vuestros padres
de vuestro paradero.\e

\h(«Don»)Niño, no se trata de una grieta celeste
cualquiera……\e

\h(«Don»)Este cabo fue descubierto durante la guerra……
Y aquí se construyó esta ciudad.\e

\h(«Don»)Este sitio está en el confín del mundo. Si
intentas ir más allá en dirección Este, morirás.
Cientos de personas…… murieron en el intento.\e

\h(«Don»)Pero siempre hay algún idiota que no hace caso
de las advertencias. Y la Gruta Oscura acaba con
su vida……\e

\h(«Don»)Algunos de los mejores marinos del mundo han
intentado cruzar la Gruta Oscura.
Venían de todas partes del mundo……\e

\h(«Don»)Uno tras otro intentaron atravesar la Gruta
Oscura. Todos fallaron.\e

\h(«Don»)Cada navío que entra en la Gruta Oscura o es
empujado por el viento……\e
\h(«Don»)… o absorbido dentro, sin que regrese jamás.\e

\h(«Don»)Mi tripulación y yo perdimos nuestro navío.
Tuvimos suerte de sobrevivir. Tras un tiempo,
los marinos dejaron de venir.\e

\h(«Don»)Ahora sólo nos queda vagar por aquí hasta que
nos llegue la hora……\e

\h(«Marino»)Hay cosas que simplemente son imposibles, chico.
Por qué no regresas al lugar de donde viniste y
le dices a tu madre que te lea un cuento.\e

\h(«Aika»)¡¿Pero a vosotros qué os pasa?!
¡Habéis desperdiciado toda vuestra vida!
¡¿Es que no hay nada que os importe?!\e

\h(«Aika»)¡Vamos, Vyse!
Estamos perdiendo el tiempo en este sitio.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Gracias por contarme lo de la Gruta Oscura……
Pero antes de ir, quiero decir que nunca me
había tropezado con gente tan patética.\e

\h(«Vyse»)Si pierdes tu ilusión por un sueño, sustitúyela
con otro. Piensa en todas las cosas que podrías
haber hecho en el tiempo que has pasado aquí.\e

\h(«Vyse»)¿Sólo porque no pudiste cruzar la Gruta Oscura
te vas a quedar aquí cruzado de brazos durante
el resto de tus días?\e

\h(«Vyse»)¿Sólo porque intentaste algo una vez y fallaste,
vas a tirar el resto de tu vida por la borda?\e

\h(«Vyse»)¡Ahí fuera hay todo un mundo esperándote!
¿No tienes ningún deseo de navegar otra vez?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Fina, ¿qué te pasa?\e

\h(«Fina»)¡Vyse! ¡Aika!
¡Venid al puerto! ¡Deprisa!\e
\h(«Fina»)¡¡¡Viene la Armada!!!\e

\h(«Aika»)¡¿Qué?!
¡¿Qué están haciendo aquí?!\e

\h(«Vyse»)¡Aika, vámonos!
Tenemos que volver al puerto, rápido.\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)Heh… it's been many years since someone outside
of Nasr has stayed here.\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)It's 280 gold for one night.
Do you want to stay?\e

\h(«What will you do?»)“Stay the night.”
“Leave.”\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)Well then, I'll prepare a room for you right
away.\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)I hope you had a pleasant rest.
I do not know where your travels take you,
but may the Red Moon always watch over you.\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)I see… well, there aren't any other places to
rest in this city. Perhaps you will change your
mind later. Have a nice day.\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)Hey… you don't have enough money.
Come back when you do.\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)I heard about you guys!
You defeated the Armada with 
just a single ship, right?\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)The Valuans are our old enemies… you have won a
victory for us! Please… stay the night here!
For free, of course! You are heroes!!!\e

\h(«What will you do?»)“Stay the night.”
“Leave.”\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)You'll stay? I am honored…
May the Red Moon watch over you in your sleep…\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)I once heard from a man that managed to survive
a shipwreck in the Dark Rift that there are
strange plants called “Lenautos.”\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)He said that he survived by following the paths
on which these things grew. I wonder what they
look like…\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)I see… that's too bad.
Well then, I hope that the Red Moon watches
over your journeys.\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)Hey, you're the Air Pirates that defeated the
Armada a little while back!\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)The Valuans are our old enemies… you have won a
victory for us! Please… stay the night here!
For free, of course! You are heroes!!!\e

\h(«What will you do?»)“Stay the night.”
“Leave.”\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)You'll stay? I am honored…
Please, rest well…\e

\h(«Innkeeper»)Did you sleep well?
Please, if the winds of fate ever blow your ship
this way, do not hesitate to stay here again…\c

\h(«Innkeeper»)I see… Well, I do not know what fate has in
store for you, but I hope all goes well.\c

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)Just looking at this fortified lighthouse, you 
can see how important this city was to Valua…\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)But now, it's nothing more than just a giant 
tower of metal… broken cannons and all.\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)Well, I suppose people are the same. If you're 
not constantly brushing up your skills, you'll 
start to get rusty, just like this old tower…\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)Well, we're the same as the scrap metal you see
here… nothing but useless rust. Damn you, you 
big piece of junk!\c

big piece of junk!\c

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)Gregorio?
How is that old Admiral doing, anyway?\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)He was such a great defensive strategist. Even
in Valua, he was known as “Admiral Ironwall.”\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)Oh, it's you guys.
I saw your fight with the Armada from the port.\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)If the cannons of the lighthouse weren't all 
broken and rusted, I would've joined in the 
fight.\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)I've been cleaning up the tower and trying to 
fix the cannons so they work again. That'd make 
this place a great tourist attraction!\e

\h(«Degenerate Ex-Valuan Soldier»)But these cannons won't work, no matter what I 
try to do! Pieces of junk!!\c

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I left Maramba with a sailor I was in love 
with. We were planning on moving to a country 
east of here…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)But, we heard that the Dark Rift is impossible
to cross… and he changed…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)And then one day, he met another girl and 
disappeared. He didn't even bother to say 
goodbye.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I was foolish.
I fell for such a childish man and threw away a 
good life…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)And I… I left my mother behind. She worked so 
hard to take care of me as a child…
I wonder how she is doing…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)You say that you saw the Armada at sea?
Are you sure you weren't just seeing things?\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Are you guys serious?
You plan on fighting the Armada?
How do you expect to win with just one ship?\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)You guys are something else.
I can't believe you took on the Armada alone and
won.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)If anyone can get through the Dark Rift, it
will be you. I'm praying for your success!\c

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I heard you guys made it through the Dark Rift!!
I knew you'd be able to do it!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I have confidence in your abilities… so I have
a favor to ask of you. I would like you to
listen to my story first.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Many years ago, I eloped and came here with a 
sailor that I had fallen in love with.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)But, he found another woman and ran off with
her… I can't believe how foolish I was to trust
him.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)But, I've accepted my fate. It's not myself that
I'm worried about… it's… my mother. I left her
behind in Maramba.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)If you ever have a chance to stop by Maramba…
could you visit the Kabal Skewer shop?\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I… I want her to forgive her foolish daughter…
And I want her to know that not a day has passed
that I haven't thought of her… \e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)If you ever have a chance to stop by Maramba… 
could you visit the Kabal Skewer shop?\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I… I want her to forgive her foolish daughter…
And I want her to know that not a day has passed
that I haven't thought of her… \e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)What? You went to Maramba and spoke with my 
mother?! Wh, what did she say?!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)…I see.
I guess you can't expect her to forgive such a 
selfish daughter so easily…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)But, I was telling the truth when I said that 
I've never stopped thinking about her…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)And my mother isn't young anymore… I worry
about her health. What can I do?\e

\h(«Aika»)Hm… that lady seemed real hard-headed, though…
I wonder if there really is anything that
we can do.\e

\h(«Fina»)Perhaps if we can somehow prove to your mother
that you haven't stopped thinking about her all
these years…\e

\h(«Aika»)Prove to her?
Hm… Now, if only there was something we could
show her… something to prove it…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)…I know a way!
There's one thing I can show her to prove it!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Kabal Skewers! When I was little, my mother
would try and teach me her special Kabal Skewer
recipe.\e

\h(«Aika»)Yeah! And if you can make a Kabal Skewer using
her recipe, it'll show your mom that you haven't
forgotten what she taught you!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Would you mind waiting for a little bit? I'm 
going to make some Kabal Skewers!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)It's done.
If you can get my mother to eat this, I'm sure 
she'll understand how I feel.\e
\h( )You received 1 “Kabal Skewer.”\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Please make sure that you get my Kabal Skewer to
my mother in Maramba. I'm begging you…\c

\h(«Tavernkeep»)What?! You ate my Kabal Skewer?
Oh, well…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Here… I made another one.
Please bring it to my mother in Maramba.\e
\h( )You received 1 “Kabal Skewer.”\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)You brought the Kabal Skewer to my mother in 
Maramba? What did she say?!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)…Huh?
She said that the Kabal Skewer that I made
didn't taste the same as hers?\e

\h(«Aika»)Um… she said that it smelled funny, it wasn't 
spiced correctly, and the quality of the meat 
you used is different.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)…She noticed, huh? There's no way I can
duplicate my mother's Kabal Skewers with the
ingredients in this town…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I remember exactly how to cook it.
But I don't have the same ingredients
and spices… What should I do?\e
\h(«Vyse»)Tell us what you need. We'll bring it to you.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Really?!
That would be a great help!
Here's what I need…\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)I'll need “Gentum” for the scent,
“Khale” for seasoning, and “Kabal” meat.\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Would you bring these three ingredients to me?
If I have these, I know I will be able to make 
my mother's special Kabal Skewer…\e
\h(«Aika»)“Gentum,” “Khale,” and “Kabal?” Leave it to us!\e

\h(«Tavernkeep»)Remember, it's “Gentum,” “Khale,” and “Kabal!”
Please bring them to me as soon as you find them
all!\c
\h(«Tavernkeep»)What?! You found all three ingredients?\e

\h(«Vyse»)Yup.
